text: little question: the filter `selectattr`, can use only `equalto`?
Well, not working for me lol

ok, nevermind, I just found the issue…
I think the docs can be improved

as here <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/hubdb> they say to use `selectattr` and go here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows> to check with `filterQuery` can be used…

But if you’re in a hubl template, you must use `string_containing` instead of `contains` of the API…
^ <@UFWNSVCHE> FYI, something to look at for our docs

Anybody know if there's hubl for item number? Example: I have a repeater module with a popup. Each popup needs a unique ID, in the past I've added an ID field and then used that in the JS to call the popup, but I figure there's some sort of hubl for the item number in the repeater.
If you are looping through you can you use the loop.index <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/for-loops>

I believe you can also use `{{name}} as a var. If the module is going to be used multiple times on a page, using this can help when adding JS to the module as you can target that specific instance of the module on the page where it may be 3 times
is there a way to give my end users the Rich Text wysiwyg experience but allow them to embed variables into the text?  like {{ custom_var }} inside the rich text module
